intro: Brassica kaber var. orientalis, commonly known as oriental mustard, is an annual plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many economically important crops such as cabbage and broccoli. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring erect stems and lobed leaves. Its small yellow flowers are arranged in racemes and bloom in the spring. The seeds are encased in a hard pod and are used in traditional medicine and as a spice in some cuisines.
